The app contains a small number of themed screens. The adult or toddler touches the themed box where the child is given an animation of three items that reflect the theme. For example: when you choose the Fruits themed box three fruits appear. The child touches each fruit and the narrator names the fruit. Then the narrator asks the child to touch the fruit that he names. The problem is that Toddlers do not just touch once and wait for the narrator to speak before touching another fruit. It ends up sounding like a rap song and even when the child touches the correct item, there is such a lag from all the repeats that the child is confused and gets frustrated. This is the structure for every theme, of which I think there are about 9.

The bundles for purchase do nothing other than get you closer to prestiging where can again earn XP and buy more bundles. Waste of time.

Where to start? In terms of being a calendar you would use daily, for personal or professional, this calendar app is not it. It is not practical.  Its visual identity is more geared to be interesting than useable. It is “neat.” Yet, a good calendar neat alone does not make. 

If you’re in the mood to view this app as art rather than a calendar you’ll use as a calendar, I would take a look. Otherwise, go in knowing that the functionality that brings it anywhere close to a useable calendar is $30/year.

I’m writing after I saw that your sleep sound app “Moonlight : Sleep & Sounds” was shown as the top feature over on App Advice, with your lifetime subscription being offered for free just for today only. I read everything over and I was excited to accept your offer and then try things out (sleep issues seem to be somewhat of a constant for me since I reached adulthood). I followed the link, completed the download of your app and then I began the onboarding process (all pretty standard fair when accepting this sort of an offer through App Advice. Of which, I’ve been doing for close to ten years now). However, something wasn’t working the way I assumed it ought to when trying to accept your offer today. When I reached  the screen suggesting I upgrade to the premium version of Moonlight : Sleep & Sounds, that was where I encountered the issue. Your offer was for a free lifetime subscription to your apps premium features, yet I was seeing all options priced normally. Generally, the lifetime option will show a price of $0.00 for you to select and “purchase” in the App Store when accepting these type of lifetime subscription offers through App Advice. I don’t feel comfortable going any further with the process with the lifetime subscription showing the full $29.99 price as that isn’t how this normally works. And if I end up being charged the full price, I know that trying to get an app developer to issue you a refund, regardless of the issue you experienced, that shi…. just isn’t happening, you know? I went back onto App Advice and the offer had not yet expired, so that shouldn’t be the issue, I don’t think. 

    How ‘bout a little help here aye? I would really appreciate it if you wouldn’t mind extending yourself and maybe helpin’ a brotha on this one. Is there someone I could message about this to see about getting  some help with this matter? Of course, I will straight away go and fix this rating and review after receiving y’all’s help on this issue. But yeah, I really hope to hear back from you about this issue I had and I look forward to trying out your new sleep app. Thanks guys! 🤝🏼

Craig

So i like the game aspect of this, i think they introduce words well and all that, that isn’t where i have my issue. My issue comes from combat being based both on correct answers and time it takes to answer. This isn’t great for people who take longer to read in any language, this is especially difficult if the language isn’t using the latin alphabet. I’m learning Russian, so i’m having to remember a whole new alphabet, read and process it quickly, i’m a native english speaker and i can’t even do that with english! At least when i came into this i already knew the alphabet because i’m using this to supplement my duolingo lessons as well. I also find it very unfair that people at a much higher level, using the fluency pass can be matched with you in PvP. 90% of the questions i am left guessing on.

I’m not going to give up on playing, but thats my two cents on it. I am otherwise happy with the game, and do think it will help solidify and further my learning.

This app provides functionality built in to iOS, plus it shows you ads or makes you pay. Here is how to scan a QR code for free without downloading any apps: (1) Save the image to your phone or take a screenshot. (2) View the image in the Photos app or tap the screenshot thumbnail. (3) Tap the icon in the bottom right; it looks like some lines of text with square corners around it. (4) Tap the QR code.

I like that that app has many different sounds to chose from but this is where it ends. Other than that, the app has too many problems:

There doesn’t seem to be a way to edit custom or system scenes. 
Creating new scenes is super unintuitive and fiddly. 
It is not clear when the timer actually works and when it doesn’t. I had the timer running and once in a while the sound continues even after the timer stops. 
And talking about stopping the sound, why is there no option to fade out the sound rather than abruptly stopping it. With that, it is not possible (at least for me), to use the app to fall asleep. 
The sound quality is only mediocre, e.g. the Brown Noise has a clicking sound every few seconds, or the rain is very short and then repeats in a very obvious manner. 

It is unfortunate, but this app is not for me.

I like the game, but I find it very odd that 1: I play the same name people all the time (that is not possible - people choose unique names in games). How many Staceys, Eunices, Jonathans etc are there in this game that are supposedly worldwide). 2: Either you or your opponents get an inordinate amounts of jokers so it is rarely a fair game. 3: Too many play the game in exactly the same strategic way (not normal). 4: More often that not you get all your cards to be black or all red, which throws the game off b/c you can’t play defense that well. Too many glitches for it to be “coincidence”. I say it is rigged algorithm. In the real board game you only get 2 decks of cards which allows you to strategize and you don’t get a long game just for kicks (or the inordinate number of jokers and card numbers). Just saying.

PayPal contacted them to get more information to see if it was worth a refund and whatever they said, denied my claim. I am giving this app a low rating hoping to get some help.  I really like how easy this app was to use.  It automatically recognized my document, scanned it and visually formatted it perfectly on my phone.  I was able to easily share the scanned document to Dropbox.  I opened the file on my computer to include it with some other files in an email, but the scanned document was huge!  I had to reduce the size of the document to 35 percent to make it fit on a page.   Listen, I know I’m getting older and my mind may be declining, but I like this app and would like to use it primarily to scan documents.  I just can’t until someone tells me what I’m doing wrong.

When an item has expired, the ONLY notification you get is on your device. It would be much better if you got an email notification. Also, when an item is expired, I was hoping that the expiration date would turn red or something to notify me within the app that something has expired. No such luck. If there was an option to somehow sort items that are going to expire sooner, so then, at least you could make a note to use them up quicker, that would help. However, there is no such option. Also, if you happen to enter the expiration date as a date that has already passed, the system does not flag it at all.
Got a response from the developer that only one of my concerns has been addressed - the expired items now appear in red.

This app is terrible. Even the articles in the Wall Street journal about it are all made up stories. From people who are friends with the developers.

To be short this game is terrible. I shouldn’t get hit by a roller coaster 45 times before I can aim a shot only to be hit by it 29 more times. The same concept applies to most levels. At minimum there should be a ghost effect until you make your next shot once the ball has been set. A power bar would be better than numbers 0-100 for visual and speed of shoot purposes. Physics seem a bit off when the ball bounces. Over the gameplay is awful. The level designs and concepts however are amazing. Potentially a great game.

Just on the sounds I’d give this app a 5. But the interface is just to disjointed and hard to use.   

The individual volume sliders are way too small and not sensitive enough. I have smaller hands and can’t get a volume set where I’d like.  It would be impossible with bigger fingers. 

Perhaps a thorough tutorial would help with some things. Make the sliders much larger and easier to set at a given lever. Explain some of the non-intuitive icons as I sort of understand what they do, but no idea what they really mean. 

A few interface tweaks and this would be a top notch relaxation app.

Loops could be longer or with better connections.  Specially cat purr.  My cat never starts and stops every 3 seconds.

I was so excited to find this app, I thought it could help postpartum depression and anxiety, without having to set appointments to go see a therapist in my very busy life. It’s fine as a service of translating books, but that’s all it does. It doesn’t work as a reader since you can’t do basic things like search text, highlight text, bookmark, TTS, markup, etc. That would be fine if you could just export the pdf, since I already have a reader, but you cannot, and this is definitely the biggest problem. There’s no option to upload your own pdfs either, which I’d say is the second biggest problem

Not allowing family sharing for premium subscribers is a big miss by devs that have otherwise built a quality app. It’s impractical to hand over my phone each time my wife or kids want to use the app to work with our dogs, and paying for a subscription for each family member—five in my case—is way out of sync with the value IMO. I’ve deleted the app but will reinstall and update my rating if the devs add family sharing.

If you’re considering the app, there are a couple other considerations of note: 1) You can only have one dog/puppy profile. You can’t track multiple dogs. 2) No iCloud back up/restore/sync.

I’ve done the onboarding but now I’m stuck.
